summary: This document is an email chain between an FBI Victim Services Division representative and a law firm regarding an FBI briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses arrangements for a confidential client to attend a briefing in Miramar, Florida, on October 15, 2019, and includes security protocols and confidentiality concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI Victim Services Division briefings; the perpetrator whose victims are being invited to attend the meetings.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in Miramar
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein held at the Miami Field Office in Miramar, Florida.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in New York
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein held at the New York Field Office.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division organized briefings for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019 in Miramar, Florida, and New York City.

A law firm representing a confidential victim of Epstein communicated with the FBI to arrange the victim's attendance, emphasizing the need to protect the victim's identity as it had never been publicly released.
The FBI required detailed security information (including full name, social security number, and address) for anyone attending the briefings, as they were held in federal buildings.
The email chain shows coordination between law enforcement and legal representatives to provide victim services and information following Epstein's case.
